intro: Collomia diversifolia, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Collomia diversifolia is part of the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its showy flowers and hairy stems.
